questions.reason: Annual loss expectancy (ALE) is calculated based on the average impact and frequency of incidents over time.

questions.question: A security practitioner has been asked to model best practices for disaster recovery (DR) and business continuity. The practitioner has decided that a formal committee is needed to establish a business continuity policy. Which of the following BEST describes this stage of business continuity development?
choices: Developing and Implementing business continuity plans (BCP)
questions.reason: Establishing a committee for policy creation is part of the initiation and management phase of business continuity planning.

questions.question: What physical characteristic does a retinal scan biometric device measure?
choices: The amount of light reflected by the retina
The pattern of blood vessels at the back of the eye
The size, curvature, and shape of the retina
The pattern of light receptors at the back of the eye
questions.correct_answer: The pattern of blood vessels at the back of the eye
questions.reason: Retinal scans identify unique blood vessel patterns in the eye, a reliable biometric measure for identity verification.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST represents a defense in depth concept?
choices: Network-based data loss prevention (DLP), Network Access Control (NAC), network-based Intrusion prevention system (NIPS), Port security on core switches
Host-based data loss prevention (DLP), Endpoint anti-malware solution, Host-based integrity checker, Laptop locks, hard disk drive (HDD) encryption
Endpoint security management, network intrusion detection system (NIDS), Network Access Control (NAC), Privileged Access Management (PAM), security information and event management (SIEM)
Web application firewall (WAF), Gateway network device tuning, Database firewall, Next-Generation Firewall (NGFW), Tier-2 demilitarized zone (DMZ) tuning
questions.correct_answer: Endpoint security management, network intrusion detection system (NIDS), Network Access Control (NAC), Privileged Access Management (PAM), security information and event management (SIEM)
questions.reason: Implementing layered security controls at various points in the network, such as endpoint security and SIEM, embodies a defense in depth strategy.

questions.question: Which of the following is required to verify the authenticity of a digitally signed document?
choices: Digital hash of the signed document
questions.reason: The recipient uses the sender's public key to verify the digital signature, ensuring the authenticity and integrity of the document.

questions.question: Which of the following contributes MOST to the effectiveness of a security officer?
choices: Developing precise and practical security plans
Integrating security into the business strategies
Analyzing the strengths and weakness of the organization
questions.correct_answer: Integrating security into the business strategies
questions.reason: Aligning security initiatives with business objectives strengthens organizational security and enhances strategic impact.

questions.question: Where can the Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) list of associated vulnerabilities be found?
choices: OWASP Software Assurance Maturity Model (SAMM) Project
questions.reason: The OWASP Top 10 Project provides a widely recognized list of critical web application vulnerabilities to aid developers in securing software.

questions.question: Employee training, risk management, and data handling procedures and policies could be characterized as which type of security measure?
questions.reason: Administrative controls focus on policies, procedures, and people management, integral to an organizationâ€™s security framework.

questions.question: A hospital's building controls system monitors and operates the environmental equipment to maintain a safe and comfortable environment. Which of the following could be used to minimize the risk of utility supply interruption?
choices: Digital protection and control devices capable of minimizing the adverse impact to critical utility
Standardized building controls system software with high connectivity to hospital networks
Lock out maintenance personnel from the building controls system access that can impact critical utility supplies
Digital devices that can turn equipment off and continuously cycle rapidly in order to increase supplies and conceal activity on the hospital network
questions.correct_answer: Digital protection and control devices capable of minimizing the adverse impact to critical utility
questions.reason: Advanced control devices can prevent disruptions in critical utility services, maintaining essential hospital functions.

questions.question: Which of the following statements BEST distinguishes a stateful packet inspection firewall from a stateless packet filter firewall?
choices: The SPI inspects traffic on a packet-by-packet basis.
The SPI inspects the flags on Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) and User Datagram Protocol (UDP) packets.
The SPI is capable of dropping packets based on a pre-defined rule set.
The SPI inspects the traffic in the context of a session.
questions.correct_answer: The SPI inspects the traffic in the context of a session.
questions.reason: A stateful packet inspection firewall assesses packet context within a session, whereas a stateless firewall does not track session state.

questions.question: What is the MAIN purpose of conducting a business impact analysis (BIA)?
choices: To determine the cost for restoration of damaged information system
To determine the controls required to return to business critical operations
To determine the critical resources required to recover from an incident within a specified time period
To determine the effect of mission-critical information system failures on core business processes
questions.correct_answer: To determine the effect of mission-critical information system failures on core business processes
questions.reason: A BIA assesses the impact of IT system failures on business functions, guiding continuity and recovery efforts.

questions.question: Which algorithm gets its security from the difficulty of calculating discrete logarithms in a finite field and is used to distribute keys, but cannot be used to encrypt or decrypt messages?
questions.reason: The Diffie-Hellman algorithm enables secure key exchange without encrypting data directly.

questions.question: Which of the following is established to collect information in accordance with pre-established metrics, utilizing information readily available in part through implemented security controls?
questions.reason: ISCM supports ongoing assessment of security posture through regular collection of relevant security metrics.

questions.question: When conducting a remote access session using Internet Protocol Security (IPSec), which Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model layer does this connection use?
questions.reason: IPSec operates at the OSI model's network layer to secure IP communications.

questions.question: Which of the following is the MOST effective corrective control to minimize the effects of a physical intrusion?
choices: Rapid response by guards or police to apprehend a possible intruder
Sounding a loud alarm to frighten away a possible intruder
Automatic videotaping of a possible intrusion
Activating bright lighting to frighten away a possible intruder
questions.correct_answer: Rapid response by guards or police to apprehend a possible intruder
questions.reason: Corrective controls mitigate the impact of incidents; in this case, a rapid response provides the best method to control damage.

questions.question: Which of the following are the three MAIN categories of security controls?
questions.reason: Security controls are categorized into administrative, technical, and physical measures for managing risk.

questions.question: Which is the PRIMARY mechanism for providing the workforce with the information needed to protect an agency's vital information resources?
choices: Implementation of access provisioning process for coordinating the creation of user accounts
Incorporating security awareness and training as part of the overall information security program
An information technology (IT) security policy to preserve the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of systems
Execution of periodic security and privacy assessments to the organization
questions.correct_answer: Incorporating security awareness and training as part of the overall information security program
questions.reason: Security awareness and training programs equip employees with the knowledge to protect critical assets, supporting an organization's overall security framework.

questions.question: Which of the following is considered the FIRST step when designing an internal security control assessment?
choices: Create a plan based on comprehensive knowledge of known breaches.
Create a plan based on reconnaissance of the organization's infrastructure.
Create a plan based on a recognized framework of known controls.
Create a plan based on recent vulnerability scans of the systems.
questions.correct_answer: Create a plan based on a recognized framework of known controls.
questions.reason: Using established frameworks ensures the security assessment is grounded in best practices, providing consistency and thoroughness.

questions.question: The Open Web Application Security Project's (OWASP) Software Assurance Maturity Model (SAMM) allows organizations to implement a flexible software security strategy to measure organizational impact based on what risk management aspect?
questions.reason: OWASP SAMM provides a strategy to align software security practices with an organization's acceptable level of risk, known as risk tolerance.

questions.question: What is the PRIMARY reason that a bit-level copy is more desirable than a file-level copy when replicating a hard drive's contents for an e-discovery investigation?
choices: The corruption of files is less likely.
Files that have been deleted will be transferred.
The file and directory structure is retained.
File-level security settings will be preserved.
questions.correct_answer: Files that have been deleted will be transferred.
questions.reason: A bit-level copy includes all data on the disk, including deleted files, essential for thorough forensic analysis.

questions.question: An organization outgrew its internal data center and is evaluating third-party hosting facilities. In this evaluation, which of the following is a PRIMARY factor for selection?
choices: Facility provides an acceptable level of risk
Facility has physical access protection measures
Facility provides the most cost-effective solution
questions.correct_answer: Facility provides an acceptable level of risk
questions.reason: Third-party hosting evaluations prioritize a risk assessment to ensure facilities align with the organizationâ€™s risk tolerance and security needs.

questions.question: A large manufacturing organization arranges to buy an industrial machine system to produce a new line of products. The system includes software provided to the vendor by a third-party organization. The financial risk to the manufacturing organization starting production is high. What step should the manufacturing organization take to minimize its financial risk in the new venture prior to the purchase?
choices: Require that the software be thoroughly tested by an accredited independent software testing company.
Hire a performance tester to execute offline tests on a system.
Calculate the possible loss in revenue to the organization due to software bugs and vulnerabilities, and compare that to the system's overall price.
Place the machine behind a Layer 3 firewall.
questions.correct_answer: Require that the software be thoroughly tested by an accredited independent software testing company.
questions.reason: Thorough, independent testing of third-party software ensures functionality and minimizes risks before deployment.

questions.question: Which of the following is the BEST method a security practitioner can use to ensure that systems and sub-systems gracefully handle invalid input?
questions.reason: Negative testing examines how systems handle unexpected or invalid input, helping to prevent vulnerabilities.

questions.question: Commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) software presents which of the following additional security concerns?
choices: Vendors take on the liability for COTS software vulnerabilities.
In-house developed software is inherently less secure.
COTS software is inherently less secure.
Exploits for COTS software are well documented and publicly available.
questions.correct_answer: Exploits for COTS software are well documented and publicly available.
questions.reason: COTS software has known vulnerabilities that are often documented, making it more susceptible to exploitation.

questions.question: When conducting a third-party risk assessment of a new supplier, which of the following reports should be reviewed to confirm the operating effectiveness of the security, availability, confidentiality, and privacy trust principles?
questions.reason: SOC 2 Type 2 reports validate the operational effectiveness of controls relevant to security, availability, and confidentiality.

questions.question: Which of the following would be the BEST mitigation practice for man-in-the-middle (MITM) Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) attacks?
questions.reason: TLS provides encryption for VoIP traffic, protecting it from interception in man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks.

questions.question: The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) is concerned about business application availability. The organization was recently subject to a ransomware attack that resulted in the unavailability of applications and services for 10 working days that required paper-based running of all main business processes. There are now aggressive plans to enhance the Recovery Time Objective (RTO) and cater for more frequent data captures. Which of the following solutions should be implemented to fully comply to the new business requirements?
questions.reason: Virtualization allows for quicker recovery times through snapshots and backups, meeting enhanced RTO requirements.

questions.question: What is the MOST appropriate hierarchy of documents when implementing a security program?
questions.reason: In a security program, policies outline high-level principles, followed by specific standards and guidelines for implementation.

questions.question: Which of the following is the MOST important consideration in selecting a security testing method based on different Radio-Frequency Identification (RFID) vulnerability types?
choices: An understanding of the attack surface
Adaptability of testing tools to multiple technologies
The quality of results and usability of tools
The performance and resource utilization of tools
questions.correct_answer: An understanding of the attack surface
questions.reason: Identifying the attack surface is essential for effective security testing, especially for RFID vulnerabilities.

questions.question: An organization's internal audit team performed a security audit on the company's system and reported that the manufacturing application is rarely updated along with other issues categorized as minor. Six months later, an external audit team reviewed the same system with the same scope, but identified severe weaknesses in the manufacturing application's security controls. What is MOST likely to be the root cause of the internal audit team's failure in detecting these security issues?
questions.reason: Test coverage analysis ensures thorough assessment and detection of potential weaknesses that may be missed otherwise.

questions.question: Which of the following is a limitation of the Bell-LaPadula model?
choices: Segregation of duties (SoD) is difficult to implement as the "no read-up" rule limits the ability of an object to access information with a higher classification.
Mandatory access control (MAC) is enforced at all levels making discretionary access control (DAC) impossible to implement.
It contains no provision or policy for changing data access control and works well only with access systems that are static in nature.
It prioritizes integrity over confidentiality which can lead to inadvertent information disclosure.
questions.correct_answer: It contains no provision or policy for changing data access control and works well only with access systems that are static in nature.
questions.reason: The Bell-LaPadula model focuses on confidentiality and is less effective in dynamic access environments where permissions need frequent updates.

questions.question: Which of the following vulnerability assessment activities BEST exemplifies the Examine method of assessment?
choices: Asking the Information System Security Officer (ISSO) to describe the organization's patch management processes
Ensuring that system audit logs capture all relevant data fields required by the security controls baseline
Logging into a web server using the default administrator account and a default password
Performing Port Scans of selected network hosts to enumerate active services
questions.correct_answer: Asking the Information System Security Officer (ISSO) to describe the organization's patch management processes
questions.reason: Examine method involves assessing policies and procedures by gathering information directly from personnel or documentation.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST ensures the integrity of transactions to intended recipients?
questions.reason: Blockchain technology inherently provides transaction integrity, with data being immutable and validated by consensus.

questions.question: Recently, an unknown event has disrupted a single Layer-2 network that spans between two geographically diverse data centers. The network engineers have asked for assistance in identifying the root cause of the event. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?
questions.reason: A large broadcast domain across diverse data centers can lead to disruptions due to excessive broadcast traffic.

questions.question: A company is moving from the V model to Agile development. How can the information security department BEST ensure that secure design principles are implemented in the new methodology?
choices: Information security requirements are captured in mandatory user stories.
All developers receive a mandatory targeted information security training.
The information security department performs an information security assessment after each sprint.
The non-financial information security requirements remain mandatory for the new model.
questions.correct_answer: Information security requirements are captured in mandatory user stories.
questions.reason: Including security requirements in user stories ensures they are addressed in each sprint cycle, aligning with Agile principles.

questions.question: Which of the (ISC)Â² Code of Ethics canons is MOST reflected when preserving the value of systems, applications, and entrusted information while avoiding conflicts of interest?
choices: Provide diligent and competent service to principles.
Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and legally.
Protect society, the commonwealth, and the infrastructure.
questions.correct_answer: Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and legally.
questions.reason: This canon emphasizes ethical behavior and professional responsibility, essential for maintaining trust in information systems.

questions.question: Which of the following should exist in order to perform a security audit?
questions.reason: A security audit is most effective when it is based on an established framework, providing benchmarks for compliance and security practices.

questions.question: When telephones in a city are connected by a single exchange, the caller can only connect with the switchboard operator. The operator then manually connects the call. This is an example of which type of network topology?
questions.reason: In a star topology, all nodes connect to a central point, which manages communication, similar to the operator exchange model.

questions.question: A firm within the defense industry has been directed to comply with contractual requirements for encryption of a government client's Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI). What encryption strategy represents how to protect data at rest in the MOST efficient and cost-effective manner?
choices: Perform logical separation of program information, using virtualized storage solutions with encryption management in the back-end disk systems
Perform logical separation of program information, using virtualized storage solutions with built-in encryption at the virtualization layer
Perform physical separation of program information and encrypt only information deemed critical by the defense client
Implement data at rest encryption across the entire storage area network (SAN)
questions.correct_answer: Perform logical separation of program information, using virtualized storage solutions with encryption management in the back-end disk systems
questions.reason: This approach allows efficient encryption without requiring encryption of all data, focusing resources on critical information.

questions.question: Which audit type is MOST appropriate for evaluating the effectiveness of a security program?
questions.reason: An assessment audit provides an evaluation of security program effectiveness by analyzing controls and processes.

questions.question: Before allowing a web application into the production environment, the security practitioner performs multiple types of tests to confirm that the web application performs as expected. To test the username field, the security practitioner creates a test that enters more characters into the field than is allowed. Which of the following BEST describes the type of test performed?
questions.reason: Misuse case testing evaluates the application's response to inputs outside of its normal parameters, including excessively long entries.

questions.question: If the wide area network (WAN) is supporting converged applications like Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP), which of the following becomes even MORE essential to the assurance of the network?
questions.reason: Deterministic routing is crucial in a converged network, ensuring that data, voice, and video traffic are prioritized to avoid delays.

questions.question: Why would a system be structured to isolate different classes of information from one another and segregate them by user jurisdiction?
choices: The organization is required to provide different services to various third-party organizations.
The organization can avoid e-discovery processes in the event of litigation.
The organization's infrastructure is clearly arranged and scope of responsibility is simplified.
The organization can vary its system policies to comply with conflicting national laws.
questions.correct_answer: The organization can vary its system policies to comply with conflicting national laws.
questions.reason: Segregating data by jurisdiction allows policies to align with legal requirements, protecting information appropriately.

questions.question: An organization implements Network Access Control (NAC) using Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) 802.1x and discovers the printers do not support the IEEE 802.1x standard. Which of the following is the BEST resolution?
choices: Implement port security on the switch ports for the printers.
Do nothing; IEEE 802.1x is irrelevant to printers.
Install an IEEE 802.1x bridge for the printers.
Implement a virtual local area network (VLAN) for the printers.
questions.correct_answer: Implement a virtual local area network (VLAN) for the printers.
questions.reason: Creating a VLAN for non-802.1x compatible devices helps isolate them securely on the network.

questions.question: Which of the following goals represents a modern shift in risk management according to National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)?
choices: Provide an improved mission accomplishment approach.
Focus on operating environments that are changing, evolving, and full of emerging threats.
Enable management to make well-informed risk-based decisions justifying security expenditure.
Secure information technology (IT) systems that store, mass, or transmit organizational information.
questions.correct_answer: Focus on operating environments that are changing, evolving, and full of emerging threats.
questions.reason: Modern risk management considers dynamic, evolving environments to better manage and mitigate risks.

questions.question: Which of the following security tools monitors devices and records the information in a central database for further analysis?
questions.reason: EDR tools continuously monitor and store data on device activities for comprehensive threat detection and analysis.

questions.question: In addition to life, protection of which of the following elements is MOST important when planning a data center site?
questions.reason: Data and hardware are critical assets in a data center, requiring robust physical protection.

questions.question: Which of the following documents specifies services from the client's viewpoint?
questions.reason: SLAs define service expectations from the client's perspective, establishing quality and performance metrics.

questions.question: Which of the following should be included in a good defense-in-depth strategy provided by object-oriented programming for software development?
questions.reason: Encapsulation hides internal data, limiting access and providing an additional security layer in object-oriented programming.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key responsibility for a data steward assigned to manage an enterprise data lake?
choices: Ensure proper business definition, value, and usage of data collected and stored within the enterprise data lake.
Ensure adequate security controls applied to the enterprise data lake.
Ensure proper and identifiable data owners for each data element stored within an enterprise data lake.
Ensure that any data passing within remit is being used in accordance with the rules and regulations of the business.
questions.correct_answer: Ensure proper business definition, value, and usage of data collected and stored within the enterprise data lake.
questions.reason: Data stewards oversee data usage, ensuring relevance and appropriate handling across enterprise systems.

questions.question: What is the FIRST step prior to executing a test of an organization's disaster recovery (DR) or business continuity plan (BCP)?
questions.reason: Identifying stakeholders ensures that relevant individuals are involved in planning and testing DR and BCP procedures.

questions.question: A breach investigation found a website was exploited through an open source component. What is the FIRST step in the process that could have prevented this breach?
questions.reason: Tracking software components allows identification of potentially vulnerable elements for timely updates or removal.

questions.question: What security principle addresses the issue of "Security by Obscurity"?
questions.reason: Open design discourages security by obscurity, favoring transparent and robust security mechanisms.

questions.question: What is the MOST important goal of conducting security assessments?
choices: To align the security program with organizational risk appetite
To demonstrate proper function of security controls and processes to senior management
To prepare the organization for an external audit, particularly by a regulatory entity
To discover unmitigated security vulnerabilities and propose paths for mitigating them
questions.correct_answer: To discover unmitigated security vulnerabilities and propose paths for mitigating them
questions.reason: Security assessments primarily aim to uncover security vulnerabilities and recommend measures to address them.

questions.question: Which of the following virtual network configuration options is BEST to protect virtual machines (VM)?
questions.reason: Traffic filtering helps to control and restrict data flow, reducing potential exposure for virtual machines in a network.

questions.question: Which of the following features is MOST effective in mitigating against theft of data on a corporate mobile device which has been stolen?
choices: Mobile Device Management (MDM) with device wipe
Virtual private network (VPN) with traffic encryption
Whole device encryption with key escrow
questions.correct_answer: Mobile Device Management (MDM) with device wipe
questions.reason: MDM solutions with device wipe capabilities allow for the removal of sensitive data if a device is lost or stolen.

questions.question: An organization is implementing data encryption using symmetric ciphers and the Chief Information Officer (CIO) is concerned about the risk of using one key to protect all sensitive data. The security practitioner has been tasked with recommending a solution to address the CIO's concerns. Which of the following is the BEST approach to achieving the objective by encrypting all sensitive data?
choices: Use a hierarchy of encryption keys
Use Hash Message Authentication Code (HMAC) keys
questions.correct_answer: Use a hierarchy of encryption keys
questions.reason: Using a hierarchy of encryption keys enables key rotation and better key management, enhancing security for sensitive data.

questions.question: Which of the following is a MUST for creating a new custom-built, cloud-native application designed to be horizontally scalable?
questions.reason: PaaS is ideal for building cloud-native applications as it provides scalability, flexibility, and support for custom-built applications.

questions.question: Which of the following access control mechanisms characterizes subjects and objects using a set of encoded security-relevant properties?
questions.reason: ABAC uses properties and attributes for access decisions, making it ideal for dynamic access control based on contextual properties.

questions.question: Which kind of dependencies should be avoided when implementing secure design principles in software-defined networking (SDN)?
questions.reason: Circular dependencies can create complex and vulnerable interdependencies, which should be avoided to improve SDN security.

questions.question: Which mechanism provides the BEST protection against buffer overflow attacks in memory?
questions.reason: ASLR helps prevent buffer overflow attacks by randomly positioning program memory, making it harder for attackers to predict.

questions.question: Which of the following terms is used for online service providers operating within a federation?
questions.reason: In federated identity management, an RP is a service provider that relies on an identity provider for user authentication.

questions.question: The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) of a large financial institution is responsible for implementing the security controls to protect the confidentiality and integrity of the organization’s information systems. Which of the controls below is prioritized FIRST?
choices: Encryption of data in transit and data at rest
questions.correct_answer: Encryption of data in transit and data at rest
questions.reason: Prioritizing data encryption ensures both confidentiality and integrity, aligning with the primary objectives for protecting information in financial institutions.

questions.question: Who is the BEST person to review developed application code to ensure it has been tested and verified?
choices: A developer who knows what is expected of the application, but not the same one who developed it.
A member of quality assurance (QA) should review the developer’s code.
A developer who understands the application requirements document, and who also developed the code.
The manager should review the developer’s application code.
questions.correct_answer: A developer who knows what is expected of the application, but not the same one who developed it.
questions.reason: Code review by a different developer helps ensure an unbiased examination, increasing the chances of identifying issues.

questions.question: A bank failed to meet service-level agreements (SLA) with customers after suffering from a database failure of the transaction processing system (TPS) that resulted in delayed financial deposits. A regulatory agency overseeing the bank would like to determine if the cause of the delay was a material weakness. Which of the following documents is MOST relevant for the regulatory agency to review?
questions.reason: A BCP ensures critical services remain operational during failures, highlighting how a bank manages incidents impacting SLAs.

questions.question: What is the MOST effective way to ensure that a cloud service provider does not access a customer’s data stored within its infrastructure?
choices: Use the organization’s encryption tools and data management controls.
Ensure that the cloud service provider will contractually not access data unless given explicit authority.
Request audit logs on a regular basis.
Utilize the cloud provider’s key management and elastic hardware security module (HSM) support.
questions.correct_answer: Use the organization’s encryption tools and data management controls.
questions.reason: Using proprietary encryption ensures data remains unreadable by the cloud provider, preserving confidentiality.

questions.question: Prohibiting which of the following techniques is MOST helpful in preventing users from obtaining confidential data by using statistical queries?
choices: Sequences of queries that refer repeatedly to the same population
Repeated queries that access multiple databases
Selecting all records from a table and displaying all columns
Running queries that access sensitive data
questions.correct_answer: Sequences of queries that refer repeatedly to the same population
questions.reason: Limiting repetitive queries on the same data set helps reduce the risk of inference attacks on confidential information.

questions.question: Which of the following is a major component of the federated identity management (FIM) implementation model and used to establish a network between dozens of organizations?
questions.reason: A TTP in FIM manages and authenticates identity information across multiple organizations, forming a trust network.

questions.question: A Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) is considering various proposals for evaluating security weaknesses and vulnerabilities at the source code level. Which of the following items BEST equips the CISO to make smart decisions for the organization?
choices: The Common Weakness Risk Analysis Framework (CWRAF)
The Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) Top Ten
questions.reason: CWE lists common software weaknesses and is ideal for guiding secure coding practices and prioritizing vulnerability mitigation.

questions.question: Which of the following methods is MOST effective in mitigating Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities within HTML websites?
choices: Use antivirus and endpoint protection on the server to secure the web-based application
Place the web-based system in a defined Demilitarized Zone (DMZ)
Use .NET framework with .aspx extension to provide a higher level of security to the web application so that the web server display can be locked down
Not returning any HTML tags to the browser client
questions.correct_answer: Not returning any HTML tags to the browser client
questions.reason: Avoiding HTML tags reduces the risk of XSS by preventing the injection of malicious scripts into the application.

questions.question: Which of the following MOST accurately describes the Security Target (ST) in the Common Criteria framework?
choices: The set of rules that define how resources or assets are managed and protected
A product-independent set of security criteria for a class of products
The product and documentation to be evaluated
A document that includes a product-specific set of security criteria
questions.correct_answer: A document that includes a product-specific set of security criteria
questions.reason: The ST defines security requirements for a specific product, guiding its evaluation under Common Criteria.

questions.question: An organization has approved deployment of a virtual environment for the development servers and has established controls for restricting access to resources. In order to implement best security practices for the virtual environment, the security team MUST also implement which of the following steps?
choices: Implement a dedicated management network for the hypervisor
Deploy Terminal Access Controller Access Control System Plus (TACACS+) for authentication
Implement complex passwords using Privileged Access Management (PAM)
Capture network traffic for the network interface
questions.correct_answer: Implement a dedicated management network for the hypervisor
questions.reason: A dedicated management network isolates hypervisor management functions, enhancing security for the virtual environment.

questions.question: Which of the following is a weakness of the Data Encryption Standard (DES)?
choices: Use of same key for encryption and decryption
questions.reason: DES’s short key length (56-bit) is vulnerable to brute force attacks, making it less secure than modern encryption standards.

questions.question: What are facets of trustworthy software in supply chain operations?
choices: Functionality, safety, reliability, integrity, and accuracy
Confidentiality, integrity, availability, authenticity, and possession
Safety, reliability, availability, resilience, and security
Reparability, security, upgradability, functionality, and accuracy
questions.correct_answer: Safety, reliability, availability, resilience, and security
questions.reason: These facets ensure software in the supply chain is robust, secure, and dependable for mission-critical applications.

questions.question: In order to meet the project delivery deadline, a web application developer used readily available software components. Which is the BEST method for reducing the risk associated with this practice?
choices: Ensure developers are using approved software development frameworks.
Obtain components from official sources over a secured link.
Ensure encryption of all sensitive data in a manner that protects and defends against threats.
Implement a process to verify the effectiveness of the software components and settings.
questions.correct_answer: Implement a process to verify the effectiveness of the software components and settings
questions.reason: Verifying components ensures they’re secure and suitable for use, addressing risks from open-source or third-party software.

questions.question: To ensure proper governance of information throughout the lifecycle, which of the following should be assigned FIRST?
questions.reason: Identifying an owner first assigns responsibility for the information, ensuring governance and accountability throughout its lifecycle.

questions.question: An effective information security strategy is PRIMARILY based upon which of the following?
questions.reason: A risk-based approach aligns security priorities with potential threats, ensuring resources are effectively allocated.

questions.question: One of Canada’s leading pharmaceutical firms recently hired a Chief Data Officer (CDO) to oversee its data privacy program. The CDO has discovered the firm’s marketing department has been collecting information from individuals without their knowledge and consent via the company website. Which of the following privacy regulations should concern the CDO regarding this practice?
choices: The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)
The Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA)
questions.correct_answer: The Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA)
questions.reason: PIPEDA regulates how Canadian organizations handle personal information, mandating consent for data collection, thus applicable in this scenario.

questions.question: An organization is attempting to strengthen the configuration of its enterprise resource planning (ERP) software to enforce sufficient segregation of duties (SoD). Which of the following approaches would BEST improve SoD effectiveness?
choices: Implementation of frequent audits of access and activity in the ERP by a separate team with no operational duties
Implementation of strengthened authentication measures including mandatory second-factor authentication
Review of ERP access profiles to enforce the least-privilege principle based on existing employee responsibilities
Review of employee responsibilities and ERP access profiles to differentiate mission activities from system support activities
questions.correct_answer: Review of employee responsibilities and ERP access profiles to differentiate mission activities from system support activities
questions.reason: Differentiating mission-related and support activities ensures that access aligns with role responsibilities, improving SoD.

questions.question: Which type of log collection is focused on detecting and responding to attacks, malware infection, and data theft?
questions.reason: Security logs are crucial for monitoring and identifying potential threats, malware, and data breaches.

questions.question: If a medical analyst independently provides protected health information (PHI) to an external marketing organization, which ethical principle is this a violation of?
choices: Higher ethic in the worst case
questions.reason: Sharing PHI without patient consent violates ethical standards and informed consent principles.

questions.question: Which of the following measures is the MOST critical in order to safeguard from a malware attack on a smartphone?
questions.reason: Preventing jailbreaking or rooting protects the device from unauthorized apps and software, reducing malware risks.

questions.question: Which of the following Secure Shell (SSH) remote access practices is MOST suited for scripted functions?
choices: Restricting authentication by Internet Protocol (IP) address
questions.reason: Public key authentication is ideal for automated scripts due to its convenience and security.

questions.question: Which stage in the identity management (IdM) lifecycle constitutes the GREATEST risk for an enterprise if performed incorrectly?
questions.reason: Improper deprovisioning can leave access open to former employees, posing security risks.

questions.question: Which of the following reports provides the BEST attestation of detailed controls when evaluating an Identity as a Service (IDaaS) solution?
questions.reason: SOC 2 provides assurance on detailed operational and security controls, critical for IDaaS solutions.

questions.question: Single sign-on (SSO) for federated identity management (FIM) must be implemented and managed so that authorization mechanisms protect access to privileged information using OpenID Connect (OIDC) token or Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) assertion. What is the BEST method to use to protect them?
choices: Pass data in a bearer assertion, only signed by the identity provider.
Tokens and assertion should use base64 encoding to assure confidentiality.
Use a challenge and response mechanism such as Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP).
The access token or assertion should be encrypted to ensure privacy.
questions.correct_answer: The access token or assertion should be encrypted to ensure privacy.
questions.reason: Encrypting tokens and assertions ensures their confidentiality, protecting privileged information in SSO.

questions.question: The client of a security firm reviewed a vulnerability assessment report and claims the report is inaccurate. The client states that the vulnerabilities listed are not valid because the host’s operating system (OS) was not properly detected. Where in the vulnerability assessment process did the error MOST likely occur?
questions.reason: Detection errors can lead to incorrect OS identification, causing inaccuracies in the vulnerability assessment.

questions.question: For a victim of a security breach to prevail in a negligence claim, what MUST the victim establish?
questions.reason: In a negligence claim, the victim must establish proximate cause to show that the breach directly resulted in harm.

questions.question: A large international organization that collects information from its consumers has contracted with a Software as a Service (SaaS) cloud provider to process this data. The SaaS cloud provider uses additional data processing to demonstrate other capabilities it wishes to offer to the data owner. This vendor believes additional data processing activity is allowed since they are not disclosing to other organizations. Which of the following BEST supports this rationale?
choices: The data was encrypted at all times and only a few cloud provider employees had access.
As the data owner, the cloud provider has the authority to direct how the data will be processed.
As the data processor, the cloud provider has the authority to direct how the data will be processed.
The agreement between the two parties is vague and does not detail how the data can be used.
questions.correct_answer: The agreement between the two parties is vague and does not detail how the data can be used.
questions.reason: A vague agreement permits data processing ambiguity, emphasizing the need for clear data usage agreements in cloud contracts.

questions.question: A security engineer is conducting an audit of an organization’s Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) phone network due to a large increase in charges from their phone provider. The engineer discovers unauthorized endpoints have connected to the phone server from the public internet and placed hundreds of unauthorized calls to parties around the globe. Which type of attack occurred?
questions.reason: Toll fraud involves unauthorized endpoints using the VoIP system to make costly calls, impacting the phone bill.

questions.question: An organization is looking to improve threat detection on their wireless network. The company goal is to automate alerts to improve response efforts. Which of the following best practices should be implemented FIRST?
choices: Deploy a standalone guest Wi-Fi network.
Implement multi-factor authentication (MFA) on all domain accounts.
Deploy a wireless intrusion detection system (IDS).
questions.correct_answer: Deploy a wireless intrusion detection system (IDS).
questions.reason: A wireless IDS detects suspicious activity and automates alerts, enabling faster threat response.

questions.question: Security personnel should be trained by emergency management personnel in what to do before and during a disaster, as well as their role in recovery efforts. Personnel should take required training for emergency response procedures and protocols. Which part of physical security design does this fall under?
questions.reason: Emergency preparedness training prepares security personnel to respond appropriately during a disaster, ensuring continuity and safety.

questions.question: How is protection for hypervisor host and software administration functions BEST achieved?
choices: Enforce network controls using a host-based firewall.
Deploy the management interface in a dedicated virtual network segment.
The management traffic pathway should have separate physical network interface cards (NIC) and network.
Deny permissions to specific virtual machines (VM) groups and objects.
questions.correct_answer: Deploy the management interface in a dedicated virtual network segment.
questions.reason: Isolating the management interface in a dedicated network segment provides secure access control to hypervisor management.

questions.question: To ensure compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), who in the organization should the help desk manager confer with before selecting a Software as a Service (SaaS) solution?
questions.reason: The DPO is responsible for overseeing GDPR compliance and should be consulted when selecting SaaS solutions that process personal data.

questions.question: An Information System Security Officer (ISSO) employed by a large corporation, while also freelancing in a similar role for a competitor, violates what canon of the (ISC)2 Code of Professional Ethics?
choices: Provide diligent and competent service to principals
Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and legally
Protect society, the commonwealth, and the infrastructure
questions.correct_answer: Provide diligent and competent service to principals
questions.reason: Working for a competitor creates a conflict of interest, violating the ethical obligation to serve principals diligently and competently.

questions.question: Which is the FIRST action the Incident Response team should take when an incident is suspected?
choices: Record all facts regarding the incident.
questions.correct_answer: Record all facts regarding the incident.
questions.reason: Documenting facts immediately ensures a clear record of events, essential for effective incident handling and reporting.

questions.question: A hospital has three data classification levels: shareable without restrictions, shareable with restrictions, and internal use only. Which of the following BEST demonstrates adhering to principles of good enterprise data classification?
choices: A printout of the employee code of conduct marked 'shareable with restrictions' is posted in the hallway where patients have access.
A printout of the employee code of conduct marked 'internal use only' is posted in the waiting room.
A memo regarding a newly discovered data breach marked as 'internal use only' is posted on the wall in the employee lunchroom.
An electronic health record (EHR) with personally identifiable information (PII) marked as 'shareable with restrictions' is found in the employee lunchroom.
questions.correct_answer: A memo regarding a newly discovered data breach marked as 'internal use only' is posted on the wall in the employee lunchroom.
questions.reason: Posting internal use information in secure areas demonstrates adherence to data classification by restricting access to sensitive information.

questions.question: A web application requires users to register before they can use its services. Users must choose a unique username and a password that contains a minimum of eight characters. Which method MUST be used to store these passwords to ensure offline attacks are difficult?
choices: Use an encryption algorithm that is fast with a random per-user encryption key.
Use a hash function that is fast with a per-user random salt.
Use a hash function with a cost factor and a per-user random salt.
Use an encryption algorithm with a random master key.
questions.correct_answer: Use a hash function with a cost factor and a per-user random salt.
questions.reason: A hash function with a cost factor and salt adds complexity to password storage, making offline attacks more difficult.

questions.question: Which of the following is the PRIMARY objective of performing scans with an active discovery tool?
choices: Discovering changes for security configuration management (CM)
questions.reason: Active discovery tools help identify and manage all assets within an environment, ensuring accurate inventory and asset management.

questions.question: A large law firm would like to enable employees to participate in a bring your own device (BYOD) program. Only devices with up-to-date antivirus and operating system (OS) patches will be allowed on the network. Which solution will BEST enforce the security requirements?
questions.reason: NAC ensures that only devices meeting security requirements, such as antivirus and patches, gain network access.

questions.question: A security operations center (SOC) discovers a recently deployed router beaconing to a malicious website. Replacing the router fixes the issue. What is the MOST likely cause of the router’s behavior?
choices: The network administrator failed to reconfigure the router’s access control list (ACL).
The router was damaged during shipping or installed incorrectly.
The router was counterfeit and acquired through unauthorized channels.
The network administrator failed to update the router’s firmware.
questions.correct_answer: The router was counterfeit and acquired through unauthorized channels.
questions.reason: Counterfeit hardware can be pre-programmed with malicious behaviors such as beaconing to external sites.

questions.question: The principle that personally identifiable information (PII) should be kept up-to-date and relevant to the purposes for which they are to be used is attributed to which fair information practice per the United States (US) Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD)?
questions.reason: Data Quality principles require that PII is accurate, complete, and relevant to its purpose, ensuring data integrity.

questions.question: Which of the following are common components of a Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) based federation system?
choices: Client, Service Provider, identity provider (IdP), Token
Client, Service Provider, Resource Server, Grant
Client, Authorization Server, identity provider (IdP), Claim
Client, Authorization Server, Resource Server, Assertion
questions.correct_answer: Client, Service Provider, identity provider (IdP), Token
questions.reason: A SAML-based federation system includes the client, service provider, IdP, and security tokens for identity and access management.

questions.question: Which of the following is the MOST effective way to ensure hardware and software remain updated throughout an organization?
choices: Performance of frequent security configuration audits
Use an automated configuration monitoring system
questions.correct_answer: Use an automated configuration monitoring system
questions.reason: Automated configuration monitoring ensures all systems stay up-to-date with minimal manual intervention.

questions.question: When developing an electronic health record (EHR) in the United States (US), which of the following would be the BEST source of information for any compliance requirements?
questions.reason: HHS governs health data compliance in the US, including EHR regulations under HIPAA.

questions.question: An organization suspects it is receiving spoofed e-mails from a foreign-hosted web e-mail service. Where can the MOST relevant information be found to begin the process of identifying the perpetrator?
choices: E-mail logs from foreign-hosted web server
Traffic logs from the corporate firewall
Log files of the corporate Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) server
questions.reason: The message header contains routing information critical to identifying spoofed e-mails.

questions.question: A new internal auditor is tasked with auditing the supply chain. The system owner stated that the last internal auditor was terminated because the auditor discovered too many deficient controls. The auditor reports this conversation to their manager. Which of the following audit integrity principles BEST applies to this situation?
choices: Demonstrate competence while performing professional duties.
Perform professional duties with honesty, diligence, and responsibility.
Perform professional duties in accordance with company policy.
Be aware of any influences that may be exerted on professional judgment.
questions.correct_answer: Be aware of any influences that may be exerted on professional judgment.
questions.reason: Auditors must recognize external pressures to maintain integrity and avoid bias.

questions.question: An organization implements supply chain risk management (SCRM) into all phases of the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC). What methodology is MOST important to ensure that SCRM requirements are met?
questions.reason: Third-party assessments provide an objective review of vendors to identify risks, ensuring supply chain security throughout the SDLC.

questions.question: An organization needs to evaluate the effectiveness of security controls implemented on a new system. Which of the following roles should the organization entrust to conduct the evaluation?
questions.reason: Control assessors are responsible for evaluating and validating the effectiveness of implemented security controls.

questions.question: During a disruptive event, which security continuity objectives will maintain an organization’s information security to a predetermined level?
questions.reason: An information security continuity plan outlines measures to maintain security levels even during a disruptive event.

questions.question: An organization is implementing a bring your own device (BYOD) policy. What would be BEST for mitigating the risk of users managing their own devices and potentially bringing in malware?
choices: Setting up access control lists (ACL) for these devices.
Installing a firewall on the organization’s primary network.
Setting up a separate network within the organization’s demilitarized zone (DMZ).
Setting up a separate, external wired or wireless network dedicated to these devices.
questions.correct_answer: Setting up a separate, external wired or wireless network dedicated to these devices.
questions.reason: A separate network for BYOD devices limits malware exposure to critical assets.

questions.question: An organization acquired used technological equipment. This equipment will be integrated with new and existing business processes. What is the MOST appropriate consideration to identify the equipment that requires protection?
choices: Total monetary value of the acquisition
The age of the computing hardware
Stakeholder concerns of how the assets are used
Length and extent of support by the vendor
questions.correct_answer: Stakeholder concerns of how the assets are used
questions.reason: Understanding how assets will be used helps prioritize security controls for equipment with sensitive information.

questions.question: Which of the following is one of the key objectives regarding data management roles and responsibilities?
choices: Define important data ownership regardless of functions.
Establish data ownership during the final phase of a project.
questions.correct_answer: Define important data ownership regardless of functions.
questions.reason: Defining ownership ensures clear responsibilities for data security and management.

questions.question: What BEST describes data ownership?
questions.reason: Data ownership involves legal responsibilities regarding data use, protection, and compliance with applicable regulations.

questions.question: A senior security engineer has been tasked with ensuring the confidentiality and integrity of the organization’s most valuable personally identifiable information (PII). This data is stored on local file and database servers within the organization’s data center. The following security measures have been implemented to ensure that unauthorized access is detected and logged.
choices: Unauthorized access to the file server via Secure Shell (SSH)
Unauthorized access to the database server via a compromised web application
Unauthorized access to the database server via a compromised user account
Unauthorized access to the backup server via a compromised service account
questions.correct_answer: Unauthorized access to the backup server via a compromised service account
questions.reason: Backup servers can hold large volumes of sensitive data, making them attractive targets for data exfiltration.

questions.question: During the change management process, which of the following is used to identify and record new risks?
questions.reason: A risk register documents identified risks, including those from changes, for ongoing tracking and management.

questions.question: The defense strategy “never trust any input” is MOST effective against which of the following web-based system vulnerabilities?
questions.reason: By not trusting any input, developers can mitigate risks of injection attacks, which exploit unvalidated user inputs.

questions.question: What is the MOST effective way to mitigate distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks?
choices: Block access to Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) ports under attack.
Detect and block bad Internet Protocol (IP) subnets on the corporate firewall.
Engage an upstream Internet service provider (ISP).
questions.correct_answer: Engage an upstream Internet service provider (ISP).
questions.reason: Engaging an ISP can help mitigate DDoS attacks by blocking malicious traffic before it reaches the organization's network.

questions.question: Which function does 802.1X provide?
questions.reason: 802.1X is a network access control protocol that helps authenticate devices before granting network access.

questions.question: Which of the following is the PRIMARY benefit of implementing an Information Security Management System (ISMS)?
choices: Correlates system events to monitor and demonstrate system health
Improves customer confidence by demonstrating adherence to best practices
Increases employee education and awareness of security policies
Ensures user compliance with computing standards
questions.correct_answer: Improves customer confidence by demonstrating adherence to best practices
questions.reason: An ISMS provides a structured approach to security, improving trust and confidence in the organization’s security practices.

questions.question: Concerning appropriate data retention policies, which of the following is the MAIN risk factor for the availability of archived information?
choices: Data maintained offline requires a higher time to access.
Data recorded in obsolete media cannot be read.
Retention of data involves a cost.
questions.correct_answer: Data recorded in obsolete media cannot be read.
questions.reason: Archived data on obsolete media can be unreadable, impacting data availability when needed.

questions.question: Wi-Fi Protected Access 2 (WPA2) is a security protocol designed with which of the following security feature?
questions.reason: WPA2 includes protections against replay attacks, securing the data transmission in Wi-Fi networks.

questions.question: What security technique in the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) should be leveraged to BEST ensure secure development throughout a project?
questions.reason: SAST helps identify vulnerabilities early in the SDLC, ensuring secure code development.

questions.question: In designing the architecture of an access control system, it was determined that confidentiality and controlled access to information were the primary focus. Which of the following security models is the BEST choice for the organization?
questions.reason: The Bell-LaPadula model is primarily concerned with confidentiality and enforces controlled access based on data classification levels.

questions.question: An organization is developing employee training content to increase awareness of Payment Card Industry (PCI) standards. What are the three types of awareness roles applicable to the organization?
questions.reason: PCI awareness programs often categorize roles by general, specialized, and management-level requirements to ensure relevant information reaches each group.

questions.question: Which of the following is the BEST method to perform an end-to-end testing on production for both operational and security requirements?
questions.reason: Synthetic transaction analysis allows testing of both operational and security requirements in a live environment without disrupting production.

questions.question: A security architect is reviewing an implemented security framework. After the review, the security architect wants to enhance the security by implementing segregation of duties (SoD) to address protection against fraud. Which security model BEST protects the integrity of data?
questions.reason: The Clark-Wilson model enforces data integrity through well-formed transactions and separation of duties, making it effective against fraud.

questions.question: An organization is building an enterprise system using attribute-based access control (ABAC). To avoid inadvertent exposure, what should organizations do to ensure the proper handling of personally identifiable information (PII) and enforcement of PII regulations across the enterprise?
questions.reason: Trust agreements help define roles, access levels, and responsibilities to ensure that PII is handled according to regulatory requirements.

questions.question: Which of the following is a strong security protection provided by Trusted Platform Module (TPM)?
choices: Providing data integrity through digital signatures
Separation of encryption keys from storage devices
questions.correct_answer: Separation of encryption keys from storage devices
questions.reason: TPM securely stores cryptographic keys, ensuring they are separated from the main storage, adding security against physical attacks.

questions.question: An application developer is developing a web application that will store and process personal information of European Union (EU) residents. Which of the following security principles explicitly specified in General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), should the developer apply to safeguard the personal information in the application?
questions.reason: Pseudonymization helps protect personal data by replacing identifying information with artificial identifiers, aligning with GDPR principles.

questions.question: A security architect is implementing an authentication system for a distributed network of servers. This network will be accessed by users on workstations that cannot trust the identity of the user. Which solution should the security architect use to have the users trust one another?
questions.reason: Kerberos is designed for secure authentication in untrusted environments, using a trusted third party to validate users.

questions.question: Which process compares its results against a standard to determine whether the results meet the standard?
questions.reason: A security audit is a structured process of comparing systems against established standards to ensure compliance.

questions.question: A security consultant has been hired by a company to establish its vulnerability management program. The consultant is now in the deployment phase. Which of the following tasks is part of this process?
choices: Measure effectiveness of the program’s stated goals.
Determine a budget and cost analysis for the program.
questions.reason: The deployment phase involves obtaining and setting up tools and systems that will support vulnerability identification and management.

questions.question: An organization is formulating a strategy to provide access to third-party partners. The information technology (IT) department has been tasked with providing access by utilizing cloud services. Which of the following technologies is MOST commonly employed for completing the task?
questions.reason: IDaaS enables organizations to securely manage and authenticate third-party access to resources in cloud environments.

questions.question: Which of the following are key activities when conducting a security assessment?
questions.reason: Examine, interview, and test are standard activities in a thorough security assessment to gather information and validate security measures.

questions.question: An organization wants to ensure that employees who move to a different department within the organization do not retain access privileges from their former department. To this end, the organization has implemented role-based access control (RBAC). Which additional measure is MOST important to successfully limit excess access privileges?
choices: Line manager review of assigned roles
questions.correct_answer: Line manager review of assigned roles
questions.reason: Line managers are best positioned to review access privileges and roles to ensure they align with current job functions.

questions.question: An organization has experienced multiple distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks in recent months that have impacted their public-facing web and e-commerce sites that were previously all on-premises. After an analysis of the problems, the network engineers have recommended that the organization implement additional name service providers and redundant network paths. What is another recommendation that helps ensure the future availability of their web and e-commerce sites?
choices: Move all cloud-based operations back to on-premises to mitigate attacks.
Move all websites to a new location.
Review current detection strategies and employ signature-based techniques.
Review the service-level agreements (SLA) with their cloud service providers.
questions.correct_answer: Review the service-level agreements (SLA) with their cloud service providers.
questions.reason: SLAs can include guarantees for uptime and mitigation strategies that cloud providers may offer to handle DDoS attacks.

questions.question: While reviewing a web application-to-application connection, a security professional finds the use of Representational State Transfer (REST) application programming interfaces (API) and identifies it as secure. Which one of the following connection Uniform Resource Locators (URL) applies to this scenario?
questions.reason: Using HTTPS in REST APIs ensures data in transit is encrypted, which is essential for secure application connections.

questions.question: Which of the following principles is intended to produce information security professionals that are capable of vision and proactive response?
questions.reason: Information security education builds foundational knowledge and skills, enabling professionals to take proactive actions.

questions.question: An organization is the victim of a major data breach just one month after passing an external cybersecurity audit. Which of the following is the likely reason for this situation?
choices: Both the auditor and the organization validated the controls to be accurate.
The organization had the minimum level of controls in place to pass the audit.
The auditor performed an in-depth analysis of the required controls.
The audit was initiated by appropriate levels of management in the organization.
questions.correct_answer: The organization had the minimum level of controls in place to pass the audit.
questions.reason: Passing an audit often signifies meeting minimum requirements, which may not fully address all risks.

questions.question: Which of the following is the MOST effective method of defending against zero-day malware threats?
questions.reason: Application whitelisting only allows approved applications to execute, making it highly effective against unknown zero-day threats.

questions.question: Which dynamic routing protocol is BEST suited for a dispersed campus network utilizing Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) addresses?
questions.reason: OSPF version 3 supports IPv6 natively, making it ideal for modern, dispersed network infrastructures.

questions.question: Which of the following is a safeguard that could be used to validate a service provider and the authenticity of their service?
questions.reason: Code signing verifies that software is from a trusted source and has not been altered, authenticating the service provider.

questions.question: When implementing single sign-on (SSO) on a network, which authentication approach BEST allows users to use credentials across multiple applications?
questions.reason: SAML enables single sign-on (SSO) by allowing secure sharing of authentication tokens between applications.

questions.question: Which of the following processes is BEST used to determine the extent to which modifications to an information system affect the security posture of the system?
questions.reason: Security impact analysis evaluates the effects of system modifications on security, ensuring that changes do not introduce vulnerabilities.

questions.question: Which of the following attacks describes the intent behind the pivoting method used by attackers or penetration testers?
choices: Interrupt the communications flows on the network
Use a compromised or obsolete system to traverse the network
Extract sensitive data from resources on the network
Escalate compromised user permissions within the network
questions.correct_answer: Use a compromised or obsolete system to traverse the network
questions.reason: Pivoting involves using a compromised system to gain access to other parts of a network, facilitating lateral movement by attackers.

questions.question: A vendor released a security patch for a dangerous vulnerability affecting thousands of computers in an organization. Which of the following actions will the security practitioner do FIRST to mitigate the security risk?
questions.reason: Evaluating the patch ensures compatibility and stability before deployment, preventing potential issues in critical systems.

questions.question: At which layer of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model does a circuit-level firewall operate?
questions.reason: Circuit-level firewalls operate at the session layer, enabling secure connections without inspecting packet contents.

questions.question: An architect has observed the complexity of a new design has introduced increased risk. After review, the test team lead cannot determine how to test for some of the security controls the organization requires to be in place. Which of the following secure design principles has MOST likely been violated?
questions.reason: The principle of economy of mechanism states that security mechanisms should be simple to minimize risks associated with complex designs.

questions.question: An organization would like to secure a trusted and untrusted network. One of the requirements is to provide access to the trusted network from a few of the hosts from the untrusted network. Which of the following is the BEST device or system that should be deployed to enable this capability?
questions.reason: A bastion host acts as a secure gateway between a trusted network and an untrusted network, controlling access and providing a layer of security.

questions.question: Which of the following languages supports a modular program structure and was designed for military and real-time systems?
questions.reason: Ada is a language designed with a modular structure, supporting mission-critical applications, especially in real-time military systems.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes an example of evading intrusion detection system (IDS) signature detection?
questions.reason: Packet fragmentation can split malicious payloads across packets, evading IDS that rely on signature matching.

questions.question: An organization is establishing a privacy program to ensure that personally identifiable information (PII) is properly protected. What is the FIRST action the organization should take to establish the program?
choices: Appoint a senior official to oversee the privacy program.
Allocate sufficient resources to implement the privacy program.
Develop a strategic organizational privacy plan.
Monitor privacy laws and policy changes.
questions.correct_answer: Appoint a senior official to oversee the privacy program.
questions.reason: Appointing a senior official ensures the privacy program has executive support, accountability, and leadership.

questions.question: With regards to physical security, what is the MOST critical element of an organization’s recovery plan?
questions.reason: Restoring power is essential in recovery plans as it enables other systems to function and continue the recovery process.

questions.question: An application developer is deciding on the amount of idle session time that the application allows before a timeout. Which of the following is the BEST reason for determining the session timeout requirement?
questions.reason: Session timeout is typically guided by industry best practices to prevent unauthorized access due to idle sessions.

questions.question: When securing Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) text data, which is the purpose of the escape function?
choices: Ending the current process to protect the code
Providing an exit path for user input
Preventing unauthorized users from writing data
questions.reason: Escaping replaces harmful characters in HTML text, protecting against injection attacks.

questions.question: An information security consultant is asked to make recommendations for a small business to protect the access to information, stored on network drives. The small business supports several government agencies that manage highly sensitive information. Which of the following recommendations is BEST to achieve this objective?
choices: Develop and implement a security information and event monitoring system.
Develop and implement access management policies and procedures.
Develop and implement data center access policies and procedures.
Develop and implement a security operations center (SOC) for access monitoring.
questions.correct_answer: Develop and implement access management policies and procedures.
questions.reason: Access management policies and procedures provide structured controls over who accesses sensitive information, aligning with data protection requirements.
